N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 16 ยง 262.101 - Anti-drug plan

State Regulations
(a) Each operator
shall maintain and follow a written anti-drug plan that conforms to the
requirements of this Part and the DOT procedures. The plan must contain: (1)
methods and procedures for compliance
with all the requirements of this Part, including the employee assistance
program; (2)
the name and address
of each laboratory that analyzes the specimens collected for drug
testing; (3)
the name and address
of the operator's medical review officer and substance abuse professional; and
(4)
procedures for notifying
employees of the coverage and provisions of the plan. (b) The administrator or department may, after notices and opportunity for hearing as provided in
49 CFR
190.237, require the operator to amend its
plans and procedures as necessary to provide a reasonable level of
safety. Notes
